title: Blatantly refusing to listen reportable?
body:
"Don't walk in the bush, ____ is in there."

If the 2/12 walks in the bush and dies, can they be reported?

1. It isn't a matter of unskilled player, you have literally just told them it is bad.
2. It isn't like they didn't know, you literally just told them.


They intentionally walked into the bush, knowing they would die.

replies.body: It's not reportable. Annoying, sure, but not reportable. Maybe they had you muted and didn't know.
It should be reportable. How is it any different than them walking at the enemy towers from level 1?

The difference is in intent. If everyone who was unskilled in some part of the game was banned there would be noone left to play. Everyone has bad games sometimes, no exceptions. You have to learn sometime, and being removed from the learning environment isn't going to get you very far.

[What isn't reportable?](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player#h2q1)

Or maybe they didn't believe you?

Or they thought they could out play said opponent in bush?

No one in this game technically HAS to listen to anyone, they are their own player. While I do feel your pain in regards to players not listening when you know that you know better, it's not reportable.
It should be, and while everyone spends time complaining about hurt feelings and naughty words, the game won't get any better.
No it shouldn't be. Every player has the right to make their own decision in the game and as long as they are not INTENTIONALLY TRYING to ruin the game for everyone, it should not be reportable.

Horseshit. 

"I am fully aware that this action will lead to my death"

Both running into towers, and running into the enemy jungle without wards after being told not to has the same outcome.

Both situations are aware of the outcome before doing it, its a fucking joke that "it's not intentional unless I say it is".


You're just as fucking stupid as the rest of them.

> [{quoted}](name=Mickey Knox,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=VdBw9XYJ,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-24T20:49:11.518+0000)
> 
> "I am fully aware that this action will lead to my death"
> 

= intentional feeding. Just report for that, and explain the whole scenario in the report.

"Both running into towers, and running into the enemy jungle without wards after being told not to has the same outcome." 

It may have the same outcome, but both are not necessarily backed with the same intention. You are NOT the omni-god of your team,  people do NOT have to listen to you. If he thinks he can go in the enemy jungle to outplay his opponents or get a ward/steal a camp without being spotted, then he has full fucking right to do it.

"Both situations are aware of the outcome before doing it, its a fucking joke that "it's not intentional unless I say it is"." 

Do you read minds for a living? You have NO IDEA that they are fully aware of what exactly is going to happen. Just because you told them what you think the outcome would be, doesn't mean that IS what the outcome will be. You cannot always be correct. 

And who the fuck said it's only intentional if they say it is? You will know yourself, it's not that hard to fucking realise the difference, and when you do realise, you report for intentionally feeding, not for failing to listen to you, because they do not have to.

Get the fuck over yourself.

So you report someone who is walking into their team for intentional feeding and they get away with it, because "lol, just a bad game friend" was said. 

Okay.

I have no clue if you're referring to a scenario that actually happened or if that's a made up story, but I'm pretty sure if someone is intentionally feeding and gets reported for it, Riot's not going let him get away with it because someone  said "lol, just a bad game friend".... That's not how it works....

But you're saying the intent is all that matters. 

How can they determine the intent without replays?

> It isn't like they didn't know, you literally just told them.

Not necessarily. Just because you've put it in chat doesn't mean the other person has seen it. Ever heard of the mute feature? Well there are plenty of players who immediately "mute all" at the start of any given match to avoid dealing with abusive players, and such players would never see you telling them that "x champ is in that bush" because they have you muted. If you're using pings, and you use it right on top of their champion, then it could be considered "refusing to listen/communicate" if it occurs more than once (and assuming there is enough warning for them to react in each instance).

It's a learning process. 
In another players eyes they believe they know better than the random person telling them how to play.
In some cases it's true.

However, you learn better by making mistakes over and over again. You just need to expect that some players are still learning and don't like being told how to play. That being said, we never stop learning because nobody can play perfectly.
